meanings.definition: Occurring or existing before a conviction.
meanings.sent1: The preconviction evidence was crucial in the case.
meanings.sent2: She faced preconviction scrutiny from the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The preconviction paperwork was misplaced, causing a delay.
meanings.sent4: His preconviction anxiety was palpable as the trial approached.
meanings.sent5: The preconviction hearing shed light on the case details.

meanings.definition: The state of being judged guilty before a formal conviction.
meanings.sent1: He lived in constant fear of preconviction condemnation.
meanings.sent2: The preconviction of the suspect shocked the community.
meanings.sent3: The preconviction rumors spread like wildfire in the town.
meanings.sent4: Her preconviction haunted her dreams every night.
meanings.sent5: The preconviction weighed heavily on his conscience.
